docs.title: RAiD metadata
docs.text: Add introduction text here.

docs.title: RAiD-core
docs.text:
URI: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/

Name: RAiD-core

Add here some general information about the documentation site.

docs.title: Classes
docs.text: Class Description Access a metadata schema block containing RAiD access information AccessStatement a metadata schema block containing an explanation for any access type that is not ‘open’, with the explanation’s associated properties. AccessType None AlternateIdentifier a metadata schema block containing alternative local or global identifiers for the project or activity associated with the RAiD AlternateUrl a metadata schema block containing alternative URLs for the project ClosedRaid None Contributor a metadata schema block containing a contributor to a RAiD and their associated properties ContributorPosition a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative position on a project or activity ContributorRole None Date Metadata schema block containing the start and end date of the RAiD. Description a metadata schema block containing the description of the RAiD and associated properties DescriptionType a metadata schema block declaring the type of description Id a metadata schema block containing the RAiD name and associated properties. Language None Metadata None Organisation a metadata schema block containing the organisation associated with a RAiD and its associated properties OrganisationRole a metadata schema sub-block describing an organisation’s role on a project Owner None RaidDto None RaidCreateRequest None RaidUpdateRequest None RaidPatchRequest None RegistrationAgency metadata schema sub-block declaring the Registration Agency that minted the RAiD. RelatedObject a metadata schema block containing inputs, outputs, and process documents related to a RAiD plus associated properties RelatedObjectCategory a metadata schema sub-block declaring that a relatedObject is an input, output and/or process document RelatedObjectType a metadata schema sub-block describing a relatedObject’s type RelatedRaid a metadata schema block containing related RAiDs and qualifying the relationship RelatedRaidType a metadata schema sub-block qualifying the relationship with a related Raid SpatialCoverage metadata schema block containing information about any spatial region(s) or named place(s) targeted by the project SpatialCoveragePlace metadata schema sub-block containing free-text place names or descriptions plus associated metadata properties Subject metadata schema block containing the subject area of the RAiD plus associated properties SubjectKeyword metadata schema sub-block containing free-text keyword describing a project plus associated properties Title a metadata schema block containing the title of the RAiD and associated properties TitleType None TraditionalKnowledgeLabel metadata schema block containing information about Traditional Knowledge / Biocultural Labels and Notices

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Slot Description access alternateIdentifier alternateUrl annotations category a metadata schema sub-block declaring that a relatedObject is an input, outpu... contact flag indicating that the contributor as a project contact contributor created date description email embargoExpiry the date any embargo on access to the RAiD metadata ends endDate id identifier keyword metadata schema sub-block containing free-text keyword describing a project p... language a metadata schema block declaring the language of the text leader flag indicating that the contributor as a project leader license The license under which the RAiD Metadata Record associated with this Identif... metadata organisation owner a metadata schema sub-block that declares the owner of the RAiD (i place metadata schema sub-block containing free-text place names or descriptions pl... position a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative positio... raidAgencyUrl The URL for the raid via the minting raid agency system raidModelVersion registrationAgency metadata schema sub-block declaring the Registration Agency that minted the R... relatedObject relatedRaid role metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s scientific or scholarly ... schemaUri The URI of the Identifier scheme servicePoint the Service Point (SP) that requested the RAiD spatialCoverage metadata schema block containing information about any spatial region(s) or n... startDate statement a metadata schema block containing an explanation for any access type that is... status statusMessage subject metadata schema block containing the subject area of the RAiD plus associated... text title traditionalKnowledgeLabel metadata schema block containing information about Traditional Knowledge / Bi... type updated url uuid version The version of the resource

docs.title: Access
docs.text:
a metadata schema block containing RAiD access information

URI: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/class/Access

 classDiagram
    class Access
    click Access href "../Access"
      Access : embargoExpiry

      Access : statement





        Access --> "1" AccessStatement : statement
        click AccessStatement href "../AccessStatement"



      Access : type





        Access --> "1" AccessType : type
        click AccessType href "../AccessType"

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance type 1  AccessType a metadata schema block containing RAiD access type information  direct statement 1  AccessStatement a metadata schema block containing an explanation for any access type that is not ‘open’, with the explanation’s associated properties  direct embargoExpiry 0..1  date the date any embargo on access to the RAiD metadata ends  notes: Mandatory if access.type is ‘embargoed’. Embargo expiration dates may not lay more than 18 months from the date the RAiD was registered; year, month, and day must be specified. direct

docs.title: Usages
docs.text: used by used in type used RaidDto access range Access RaidCreateRequest access range Access RaidUpdateRequest access range Access ClosedRaid access range Access

docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self https://datamodel.raid.org/core/Access native https://datamodel.raid.org/core/Access

docs.title: Direct
docs.text:
name: Access
description: a metadata schema block containing RAiD access information
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
attributes:
  type:
    name: type
    description: a metadata schema block containing RAiD access type information
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - Title
    - Description
    - Access
    - RelatedRaid
    - RelatedObject
    - AlternateIdentifier
    range: AccessType
    required: true
  statement:
    name: statement
    description: a metadata schema block containing an explanation for any access
      type that is not ‘open’, with the explanation’s associated properties
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    rank: 1000
    domain_of:
    - Access
    range: AccessStatement
    required: true
    maximum_cardinality: 1
  embargoExpiry:
    name: embargoExpiry
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: Mandatory if access.type is ‘embargoed’. Embargo expiration dates may
          not lay more than 18 months from the date the RAiD was registered; year,
          month, and day must be specified.
    description: the date any embargo on access to the RAiD metadata ends
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    rank: 1000
    domain_of:
    - Access
    range: date

name: AccessStatement
description: a metadata schema block containing an explanation for any access type
  that is not ‘open’, with the explanation’s associated properties.
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
slots:
- language
attributes:
  text:
    name: text
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: mandatory if access.type.id is not ‘open’
      constraints:
        tag: constraints
        value: maximum 1,000 characters
    description: the text of an access statement that explains any restrictions on
      access
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - Title
    - Description
    - AccessStatement
    - SubjectKeyword
    - SpatialCoveragePlace
    range: string

docs.text:
URI: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/class/AccessType

 classDiagram
    class AccessType
    click AccessType href "../AccessType"

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance id 1  AccessTypeIdEnum the type of access granted to a RAiD metadata record  notes: ‘Restricted access’ and ‘Metadata only’, though part of the upstream vocabulary, are disallowed. direct schemaUri 1  AccessTypeSchemaUriEnum the URI of the access type schema  notes: The RAiD controlled list includes only a subset of the COAR vocabulary (https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/1.1/), including ‘Open access’ and ‘Embargoed access’, but excluding ‘Restricted access’ (since no permanently restricted RAiDs are allowed), and ‘Metadata only’ (since RAiDs by design contain only metadata). direct

docs.title: Direct
docs.text:
name: AccessType
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
attributes:
  id:
    name: id
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: ‘Restricted access’ and ‘Metadata only’, though part of the upstream
          vocabulary, are disallowed.
    description: the type of access granted to a RAiD metadata record
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - ClosedRaid
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedRaid
    - RelatedObject
    - AlternateIdentifier
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: AccessTypeIdEnum
    required: true
  schemaUri:
    name: schemaUri
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: The RAiD controlled list includes only a subset of the COAR vocabulary
          ([https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/1.1/](https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/1.1/)),
          including ‘Open access’ and ‘Embargoed access’, but excluding ‘Restricted
          access’ (since no permanently restricted RAiDs are allowed), and ‘Metadata
          only’ (since RAiDs by design contain only metadata).
    description: the URI of the access type schema
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedObject
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: AccessTypeSchemaUriEnum
    required: true

docs.title: AlternateIdentifier
docs.text:
a metadata schema block containing alternative local or global identifiers for the project or activity associated with the RAiD

URI: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/class/AlternateIdentifier

 classDiagram
    class AlternateIdentifier
    click AlternateIdentifier href "../AlternateIdentifier"
      AlternateIdentifier : id

      AlternateIdentifier : type

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance id 1  String an identifier other than the RAiD applied to the project or activity  notes: An alternateIdentifer.id may be any alphanumeric string that is unique within its domain of issue, for example a local identifier unique to an organisation. The alternateIdentifier.id represents an additional identifier for the same instance of the project or activity; its referent is identical to that of the RAiD. direct type 1  String free text description of the type of alternateIdentifier supplied  direct

docs.title: Usages
docs.text: used by used in type used RaidDto alternateIdentifier range AlternateIdentifier RaidCreateRequest alternateIdentifier range AlternateIdentifier RaidUpdateRequest alternateIdentifier range AlternateIdentifier

docs.title: Mappings
docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self https://datamodel.raid.org/core/AlternateIdentifier native https://datamodel.raid.org/core/AlternateIdentifier

docs.title: Direct
docs.text:
name: AlternateIdentifier
description: a metadata schema block containing alternative local or global identifiers
  for the project or activity associated with the RAiD
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
attributes:
  id:
    name: id
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: An alternateIdentifer.id may be any alphanumeric string that is unique
          within its domain of issue, for example a local identifier unique to an
          organisation. The alternateIdentifier.id represents an additional identifier
          for the same instance of the project or activity; its referent is identical
          to that of the RAiD.
    description: an identifier other than the RAiD applied to the project or activity
    examples:
    - value: 123456ABC
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - ClosedRaid
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedRaid
    - RelatedObject
    - AlternateIdentifier
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: string
    required: true
    pattern: ^\s*\S.*$
  type:
    name: type
    description: free text description of the type of alternateIdentifier supplied
    examples:
    - value: A local project ID in the university CRIS
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - Title
    - Description
    - Access
    - RelatedRaid
    - RelatedObject
    - AlternateIdentifier
    range: string
    required: true

docs.title: AlternateUrl
docs.text:
a metadata schema block containing alternative URLs for the project

URI: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/class/AlternateUrl

 classDiagram
    class AlternateUrl
    click AlternateUrl href "../AlternateUrl"
      AlternateUrl : url

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance url 1  String a link to another website related to the project or activity  notes: An alternateURL can be used to point to any other project website, whether stand-alone, organisational, or in a platform such as Open Science Framework. direct

docs.title: Usages
docs.text: used by used in type used RaidDto alternateUrl range AlternateUrl RaidCreateRequest alternateUrl range AlternateUrl RaidUpdateRequest alternateUrl range AlternateUrl

docs.title: Mappings
docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self https://datamodel.raid.org/core/AlternateUrl native https://datamodel.raid.org/core/AlternateUrl

docs.title: Direct
docs.text:
name: AlternateUrl
description: a metadata schema block containing alternative URLs for the project
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
attributes:
  url:
    name: url
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: An alternateURL can be used to point to any other project website,
          whether stand-alone, organisational, or in a platform such as Open Science
          Framework.
    description: a link to another website related to the project or activity
    examples:
    - value: https://osf.io/puwgx/ (an Open Science Framework project page)
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - AlternateUrl
    range: string
    required: true
    pattern: ^\s*\S.*$

docs.title: Contributor
docs.text:
a metadata schema block containing a contributor to a RAiD and their associated properties

URI: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/class/Contributor

 classDiagram
    class Contributor
    click Contributor href "../Contributor"
      Contributor : contact

      Contributor : email

      Contributor : id

      Contributor : leader

      Contributor : position





        Contributor --> "1..*" ContributorPosition : position
        click ContributorPosition href "../ContributorPosition"



      Contributor : role





        Contributor --> "*" ContributorRole : role
        click ContributorRole href "../ContributorRole"



      Contributor : schemaUri





        Contributor --> "1" ContributorSchemaUriEnum : schemaUri
        click ContributorSchemaUriEnum href "../ContributorSchemaUriEnum"



      Contributor : status

      Contributor : statusMessage

      Contributor : uuid

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance id 0..1  String the contributor (person) associated with a project or activity identified by a persistent identifier (PID)  notes: Allowed values are identifiers defined by contributor.schemaUri direct status 0..1  String None  readonly: True direct statusMessage 0..1  String None  readonly: True direct uuid 0..1  String None  readonly: True direct schemaUri 1  ContributorSchemaUriEnum the URI of the contributor identifier schema  notes: The controlled list of allowed identifier schemas is defined at https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.schemaUri/215 and is shared across all Registration Agencies. direct position 1..*  ContributorPosition a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative position on a project or activity  direct role *  ContributorRole metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s scientific or scholarly role on a project using the CRediT vocabulary  direct leader 0..1  Boolean flag indicating that the contributor as a project leader  notes: More than one contributor can be flagged as a leader if the project is jointly led. direct contact 0..1  Boolean flag indicating that the contributor as a project contact  direct email 0..1  String None  direct

docs.title: ContributorPosition
docs.text:
a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative position on a project or activity

URI: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/class/ContributorPosition

 classDiagram
    class ContributorPosition
    click ContributorPosition href "../ContributorPosition"
      ContributorPosition : endDate

      ContributorPosition : id





        ContributorPosition --> "1" ContributorPositionIdEnum : id
        click ContributorPositionIdEnum href "../ContributorPositionIdEnum"



      ContributorPosition : schemaUri





        ContributorPosition --> "1" ContributorPositionSchemaUriEnum : schemaUri
        click ContributorPositionSchemaUriEnum href "../ContributorPositionSchemaUriEnum"



      ContributorPosition : startDate

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance startDate 1  String date the contributor began position associated with the project or activity  notes: ISO 8601 standard date, Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available). direct endDate 0..1  String date the contributor terminated position associated with the project or activity  notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available). Recommended if an organisation has changed roles or terminated its relationship with a project direct id 1  ContributorPositionIdEnum a contributor’s administrative position in the project  notes: contributor.position.id for first-entered contributor (only) defaults to ‘Principal or Chief Investigator’ direct schemaUri 1  ContributorPositionSchemaUriEnum the URI of the position schema used  notes: Controlled list informed by Simon Cox’s Project Ontology, OpenAIRE ‘Project’ guidelines, NIH definitions, ARC definitions, and DataCite Metadata Schema 4.4 Appendix 1 Table 5 ‘Description of contributorType’. direct

docs.title: Usages
docs.text: used by used in type used Contributor position range ContributorPosition

docs.title: Annotations
docs.text: property value constraints contributors must have one and only one position at any given time (contributors may also be flagged as a ‘leader’ or ‘contact’ separately). notes This property represents a contributor’s administrative position on a project (such as their position on a grant application); use contributor.role to define for scientific or scholarly contribution.

docs.title: Mappings
docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self https://datamodel.raid.org/core/ContributorPosition native https://datamodel.raid.org/core/ContributorPosition

docs.text:
name: ContributorPosition
annotations:
  constraints:
    tag: constraints
    value: contributors must have one and only one position at any given time (contributors
      may also be flagged as a ‘leader’ or ‘contact’ separately).
  notes:
    tag: notes
    value: This property represents a contributor’s administrative position on a project
      (such as their position on a grant application); use contributor.role to define
      for scientific or scholarly contribution.
description: a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative
  position on a project or activity
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
slots:
- startDate
- endDate
slot_usage:
  startDate:
    name: startDate
    description: date the contributor began position associated with the project or
      activity
    range: string
  endDate:
    name: endDate
    description: date the contributor terminated position associated with the project
      or activity
    range: string
attributes:
  id:
    name: id
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: contributor.position.id for first-entered contributor (only) defaults
          to ‘Principal or Chief Investigator’
    description: a contributor’s administrative position in the project
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - ClosedRaid
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedRaid
    - RelatedObject
    - AlternateIdentifier
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: ContributorPositionIdEnum
    required: true
  schemaUri:
    name: schemaUri
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: Controlled list informed by Simon Cox’s Project Ontology, OpenAIRE
          ‘Project’ guidelines, NIH definitions, ARC definitions, and DataCite Metadata
          Schema 4.4 Appendix 1 Table 5 ‘Description of contributorType’.
    description: the URI of the position schema used
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedObject
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: ContributorPositionSchemaUriEnum
    required: true

description: a metadata schema block containing the description of the RAiD and associated
  properties
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
attributes:
  type:
    name: type
    description: a metadata schema block declaring the type of description
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    alias: type
    owner: Description
    domain_of:
    - Title
    - Description
    - Access
    - RelatedRaid
    - RelatedObject
    - AlternateIdentifier
    range: DescriptionType
    required: true
  text:
    name: text
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: maximum 1,000 characters
    description: the text of an access statement that explains any restrictions on
      access
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    alias: text
    owner: Description
    domain_of:
    - Title
    - Description
    - AccessStatement
    - SubjectKeyword
    - SpatialCoveragePlace
    range: string
    required: true
    pattern: ^\s*\S.*$
  language:
    name: language
    description: a metadata schema block declaring the language of the text
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: raid:language
    alias: language
    owner: Description
    domain_of:
    - Title
    - Description
    - AccessStatement
    - SubjectKeyword
    - SpatialCoveragePlace
    range: Language

docs.title: Id
docs.text:
a metadata schema block containing the RAiD name and associated properties.

URI: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/class/Id

 classDiagram
    class Id
    click Id href "../Id"
      Id : id

      Id : license

      Id : owner





        Id --> "1" Owner : owner
        click Owner href "../Owner"



      Id : raidAgencyUrl

      Id : registrationAgency





        Id --> "1" RegistrationAgency : registrationAgency
        click RegistrationAgency href "../RegistrationAgency"



      Id : schemaUri





        Id --> "1" RaidIdentifierSchemaURIEnum : schemaUri
        click RaidIdentifierSchemaURIEnum href "../RaidIdentifierSchemaURIEnum"



      Id : version

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance id 1  String The identifier of the raid, e.g. https://raid.org.au/102.100.100/zzz  direct schemaUri 1  RaidIdentifierSchemaURIEnum The URI of the Identifier scheme. For example, https://raid.org  direct registrationAgency 1  RegistrationAgency metadata schema sub-block declaring the Registration Agency that minted the RAiD.  direct owner 1  Owner a metadata schema sub-block that declares the owner of the RAiD (i.e. the organisation requesting the RAiD)  direct raidAgencyUrl 0..1  String The URL for the raid via the minting raid agency system direct license 1  String The license under which the RAiD Metadata Record associated with this Identifier has been issued.  notes: All RAiD metadata is available on a ‘no rights reserved’ basis unless prohibited by law.constrains: CC-0 only (with fallback to CC-BY-4.0 in jurisdictions where CC-0 is not allowed) direct version 1  Integer The version of the resource. Read-only. Increments automatically on update.  notes: The RAiD version number is set automatically by the RAiD Service software when a RAiD is updated. direct

docs.title: Usages
docs.text: used by used in type used RaidDto identifier range Id RaidCreateRequest identifier range Id RaidUpdateRequest identifier range Id

docs.title: Mappings
docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self https://datamodel.raid.org/core/Id native https://datamodel.raid.org/core/Id

docs.title: Direct
docs.text:
name: Id
description: a metadata schema block containing the RAiD name and associated properties.
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
attributes:
  id:
    name: id
    description: The identifier of the raid, e.g. https://raid.org.au/102.100.100/zzz
    examples:
    - value: https://raid.org/xxx.yyy/zzz
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    exact_mappings:
    - schema:identifier
    - schema:value
    domain_of:
    - ClosedRaid
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedRaid
    - RelatedObject
    - AlternateIdentifier
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: string
    required: true
  schemaUri:
    name: schemaUri
    description: The URI of the Identifier scheme. For example, https://raid.org
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    rank: 1000
    domain_of:
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedObject
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: RaidIdentifierSchemaURIEnum
    required: true
  registrationAgency:
    name: registrationAgency
    description: metadata schema sub-block declaring the Registration Agency that
      minted the RAiD.
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    close_mappings:
    - schema:provider
    rank: 1000
    domain_of:
    - Id
    range: RegistrationAgency
    required: true
  owner:
    name: owner
    description: a metadata schema sub-block that declares the owner of the RAiD (i.e.
      the organisation requesting the RAiD)
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    close_mappings:
    - schema:publisher
    rank: 1000
    domain_of:
    - Id
    range: Owner
    required: true
  raidAgencyUrl:
    name: raidAgencyUrl
    description: 'The URL for the raid via the minting raid agency system

      '
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    rank: 1000
    domain_of:
    - Id
    range: string
  license:
    name: license
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: All RAiD metadata is available on a ‘no rights reserved’ basis unless
          prohibited by law.
      constrains:
        tag: constrains
        value: CC-0 only (with fallback to CC-BY-4.0 in jurisdictions where CC-0 is
          not allowed)
    description: The license under which the RAiD Metadata Record associated with
      this Identifier has been issued.
    examples:
    - value: Creative Commons CC-0
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    exact_mappings:
    - schema:license
    rank: 1000
    domain_of:
    - Id
    range: string
    required: true
  version:
    name: version
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: The RAiD version number is set automatically by the RAiD Service software
          when a RAiD is updated.
    description: The version of the resource. Read-only. Increments automatically
      on update.
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    exact_mappings:
    - schema:version
    rank: 1000
    domain_of:
    - Id
    range: integer
    required: true

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance id 1  String the persistent identifier of the legal entity responsible for the RAiD (i.e. the ‘owner’ of a RAiD); as recognised by their Registration Agency  direct schemaUri 1  RegistrationAgencySchemaURIEnum the URI of the identifier scheme that is used to identify RAiD owners  direct servicePoint 1  Double the Service Point (SP) that requested the RAiD. SPs belong to an owner, RAiD owners can have multiple SPs; SPs do not need to be legal entities  notes: A RAiD minted by a Registration Agency must have a SP associated with an Owner affiliated with that Agency; Registration Agencies must maintain and register lists of their Service Points with the RAiD Registration Authority. direct

docs.title: Direct
docs.text:
name: Owner
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
attributes:
  id:
    name: id
    description: the persistent identifier of the legal entity responsible for the
      RAiD (i.e. the ‘owner’ of a RAiD); as recognised by their Registration Agency
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    exact_mappings:
    - schema:identifier
    domain_of:
    - ClosedRaid
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedRaid
    - RelatedObject
    - AlternateIdentifier
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: string
    required: true
    pattern: ^https:\/\/ror[.]org/.*$
  schemaUri:
    name: schemaUri
    description: the URI of the identifier scheme that is used to identify RAiD owners
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedObject
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: RegistrationAgencySchemaURIEnum
    required: true
  servicePoint:
    name: servicePoint
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: A RAiD minted by a Registration Agency must have a SP associated with
          an Owner affiliated with that Agency; Registration Agencies must maintain
          and register lists of their Service Points with the RAiD Registration Authority.
    description: the Service Point (SP) that requested the RAiD. SPs belong to an
      owner, RAiD owners can have multiple SPs; SPs do not need to be legal entities
    examples:
    - value: '20000003'
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    rank: 1000
    domain_of:
    - Owner
    range: double
    required: true

          Agencies.

    description: the persistent identifier of the RAiD Registration Agency that minted
      the RAiD

name: SpatialCoverage
description: metadata schema block containing information about any spatial region(s)
  or named place(s) targeted by the project
in_subset:
- extended
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
attributes:
  id:
    name: id
    description: spatial region or named place that is the subject or target of the
      project or activity. Repeat this property as necessary to indicate different
      locations. Do not duplicate organisational locations
    examples:
    - value: https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/ui/details.html?osmtype=R&osmid=1947835&class=boundary
        (Tundzha, Bulgaria, from OpenStreetMap)
    - value: https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/ui/details.html?osmtype=R&osmid=186382&class=boundary
        (Bulgaria, from OpenStreetMap)
    - value: https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/ui/details.html?osmtype=W&osmid=26707240&class=historic
        (Pompeii, Italy, OpenStreetMap)
    - value: https://www.geonames.org/264371/athens.html (Athens, Greece, from Geonames)
    - value: https://www.geonames.org/2161776/katoomba.html (Katoomba, NSW, Australia,
        from Geonames)
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/extended/
    domain_of:
    - ClosedRaid
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedRaid
    - RelatedObject
    - AlternateIdentifier
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: string
    required: true
  schemaUri:
    name: schemaUri
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: OpenStreetMap preferred, Geonames allowed; other geoname servers can
          be nominated by Registration Agencies.
    description: the URI of the geolocation schema used for spatialCoverage
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/extended/
    domain_of:
    - Id
    - Contributor
    - Organisation
    - RelatedObject
    - Owner
    - RegistrationAgency
    - TitleType
    - DescriptionType
    - AccessType
    - ContributorPosition
    - ContributorRole
    - OrganisationRole
    - RelatedRaidType
    - RelatedObjectType
    - RelatedObjectCategory
    - Language
    - Subject
    - SpatialCoverage
    - TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
    range: SpatialCoverageSchemaUriEnum
    required: true
  place:
    name: place
    description: metadata schema sub-block containing free-text place names or descriptions
      plus associated metadata properties
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/extended/
    rank: 1000
    domain_of:
    - SpatialCoverage

    multivalued: true
    inlined: true
    inlined_as_list: true

Only the year is required, month and day are optional (but recommended when available).default: Date record created direct endDate 0..1  String the date the project or activity title was changed or stopped being used  notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required, month and day are optional (but recommended when available).default: Date record created direct language 0..1  Language a metadata schema block declaring the language of the text  direct startDate 1  String the date the project or activity’s title began being used  notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required, month and day are optional (but recommended when available).default: Date record created direct endDate 0..1  String the date the project or activity title was changed or stopped being used  notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required, month and day are optional (but recommended when available).default: Date record created direct text 1  String a name or title by which the project or activity is known  direct type 1  TitleType a metadata schema block containing information about the title type  direct

docs.text:
name: Title
description: a metadata schema block containing the title of the RAiD and associated
  properties
from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
slots:
- startDate
- endDate
- language
attributes:
  startDate:
    name: startDate
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required, month and day are
          optional (but recommended when available).
      default:
        tag: default
        value: Date record created
    description: the date the project or activity’s title began being used
    examples:
    - value: '2023-08-28'
    - value: 2023-08
    - value: '2023'
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - Date
    - Title
    - ContributorPosition
    - OrganisationRole
    range: string
    required: true
    pattern: ^\s*\S.*$
  endDate:
    name: endDate
    annotations:
      notes:
        tag: notes
        value: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required, month and day are
          optional (but recommended when available).
      default:
        tag: default
        value: Date record created
    description: the date the project or activity title was changed or stopped being
      used
    examples:
    - value: '2023-08-28'
    - value: 2023-08
    - value: '2023'
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - Date
    - Title
    - ContributorPosition
    - OrganisationRole
    range: string
    required: false
    pattern: ^\s*\S.*$
  text:
    name: text
    description: a name or title by which the project or activity is known
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - Title
    - Description
    - AccessStatement
    - SubjectKeyword
    - SpatialCoveragePlace
    range: string
    required: true
    pattern: ^\s*\S.*$
  type:
    name: type
    description: a metadata schema block containing information about the title type
    from_schema: https://datamodel.raid.org/core/
    domain_of:
    - Title
    - Description
    - Access
    - RelatedRaid
    - RelatedObject
    - AlternateIdentifier
    range: TitleType
    required: true

docs.text:
the Service Point (SP) that requested the RAiD. SPs belong to an owner, RAiD owners can have multiple SPs; SPs do not need to be legal entities

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot Owner no

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: Double

  • Required: True

docs.title: Annotations
docs.text: property value notes A RAiD minted by a Registration Agency must have a SP associated with an Owner affiliated with that Agency; Registration Agencies must maintain and register lists of their Service Points with the RAiD Registration Authority.

docs.title: Mappings

    value: A RAiD minted by a Registration Agency must have a SP associated with an
      Owner affiliated with that Agency; Registration Agencies must maintain and register
      lists of their Service Points with the RAiD Registration Authority.
description: the Service Point (SP) that requested the RAiD. SPs belong to an owner,
  RAiD owners can have multiple SPs; SPs do not need to be legal entities

- value: '20000003'

docs.title: Access
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing RAiD access information

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: Access.AccessType
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: Access.AccessType.id
docs.text:
Description:

the type of access granted to a RAiD metadata record

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: ‘Restricted access’ and ‘Metadata only’, though part of the upstream vocabulary, are disallowed.

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/c_abf2/ https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/c_abf2/ https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/c_f1cf/ https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/c_f1cf/

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/access.type.schemaUri/208

docs.title: Access.AccessType.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the access type schema

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: The RAiD controlled list includes only a subset of the COAR vocabulary (https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/1.1/), including ‘Open access’ and ‘Embargoed access’, but excluding ‘Restricted access’ (since no permanently restricted RAiDs are allowed), and ‘Metadata only’ (since RAiDs by design contain only metadata).

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/ https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/access.type.schemaUri/207

docs.title: Access.AccessStatement
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing an explanation for any access type that is not ‘open’, with the explanation’s associated properties.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

Language

docs.title: Access.AccessStatement.Language
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

docs.title: Access.AccessStatement.Language.id
docs.text:
Description:

the language used for the access statement text, identified by a code or other identifier

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: currently limited to ISO 639:2023 (Set 3)

Regex pattern: ^\s*\S.*$

docs.title: Access.AccessStatement.Language.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the language identifier schema

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://www.iso.org/standard/74575.html https://www.iso.org/standard/74575.html

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/description.language.schemaUri/240

docs.title: Access.AccessStatement.text
docs.text:
Description:

the text of an access statement that explains any restrictions on access

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: mandatory if access.type.id is not ‘open’

constraints: maximum 1,000 characters

docs.title: Access.embargoExpiry
docs.text:
Description:

the date any embargo on access to the RAiD metadata ends

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: Mandatory if access.type is ‘embargoed’. Embargo expiration dates may not lay more than 18 months from the date the RAiD was registered; year, month, and day must be specified.

docs.title: AlternateIdentifier
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing alternative local or global identifiers for the project or activity associated with the RAiD

Requirement: optional

Cardinality:

docs.title: AlternateIdentifier.id
docs.text:
Description:

an identifier other than the RAiD applied to the project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: An alternateIdentifer.id may be any alphanumeric string that is unique within its domain of issue, for example a local identifier unique to an organisation. The alternateIdentifier.id represents an additional identifier for the same instance of the project or activity; its referent is identical to that of the RAiD.

Regex pattern: ^\s*\S.*$

docs.title: AlternateIdentifier.type
docs.text:
Description:

free text description of the type of alternateIdentifier supplied

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: AlternateUrl
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing alternative URLs for the project

Requirement: optional

Cardinality:

docs.title: AlternateUrl.url
docs.text:
Description:

a link to another website related to the project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: An alternateURL can be used to point to any other project website, whether stand-alone, organisational, or in a platform such as Open Science Framework.

Regex pattern: ^\s*\S.*$

docs.title: Contributor
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing a contributor to a RAiD and their associated properties

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1..*

docs.title: Contributor.id
docs.text:
Description:

the contributor (person) associated with a project or activity identified by a persistent identifier (PID)

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: Allowed values are identifiers defined by contributor.schemaUri

docs.title: Contributor.status
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

readonly: True

docs.title: Contributor.statusMessage
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

readonly: True

docs.title: Contributor.uuid
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

readonly: True

docs.title: Contributor.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the contributor identifier schema

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: The controlled list of allowed identifier schemas is defined at https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.schemaUri/215 and is shared across all Registration Agencies.

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://isni.org/ https://isni.org/ https://orcid.org/ https://orcid.org/

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.schemaUri/215

docs.title: Contributor.ContributorPosition
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative position on a project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1..*

constraints: contributors must have one and only one position at any given time (contributors may also be flagged as a ‘leader’ or ‘contact’ separately).

notes: This property represents a contributor’s administrative position on a project (such as their position on a grant application); use contributor.role to define for scientific or scholarly contribution.

docs.title: Contributor.ContributorPosition.startDate
docs.text:
Description:

date the contributor began position associated with the project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date, Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available).

docs.title: Contributor.ContributorPosition.endDate
docs.text:
Description:

date the contributor terminated position associated with the project or activity

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available). Recommended if an organisation has changed roles or terminated its relationship with a project

docs.title: Contributor.ContributorPosition.id
docs.text:
Description:

a contributor’s administrative position in the project

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: contributor.position.id for first-entered contributor (only) defaults to ‘Principal or Chief Investigator’

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/307 Principal or Chief Investigator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/308 Co-investigator or Collaborator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/309 Partner Investigator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/310 Consultant https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/311 Other Participant

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schemaUri/306

docs.title: Contributor.ContributorPosition.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the position schema used

docs.title: ContributorPosition
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative position on a project or activity

Requirement: optional

Cardinality:

constraints: contributors must have one and only one position at any given time (contributors may also be flagged as a ‘leader’ or ‘contact’ separately).

notes: This property represents a contributor’s administrative position on a project (such as their position on a grant application); use contributor.role to define for scientific or scholarly contribution.

docs.text:
Description:

date the contributor began position associated with the project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date, Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available).

docs.title: ContributorPosition.endDate
docs.text:
Description:

date the contributor terminated position associated with the project or activity

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available). Recommended if an organisation has changed roles or terminated its relationship with a project

docs.text:
Description:

the Service Point (SP) that requested the RAiD. SPs belong to an owner, RAiD owners can have multiple SPs; SPs do not need to be legal entities

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: A RAiD minted by a Registration Agency must have a SP associated with an Owner affiliated with that Agency; Registration Agencies must maintain and register lists of their Service Points with the RAiD Registration Authority.

docs.text:

The URL for the raid via the minting raid agency system

Cardinality: 0..1

docs.title: Id.license
docs.text:
Description:

The license under which the RAiD Metadata Record associated with this Identifier has been issued.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: All RAiD metadata is available on a ‘no rights reserved’ basis unless prohibited by law.

constrains: CC-0 only (with fallback to CC-BY-4.0 in jurisdictions where CC-0 is not allowed)

docs.title: Id.version
docs.text:
Description:

The version of the resource. Read-only. Increments automatically on update.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: The RAiD version number is set automatically by the RAiD Service software when a RAiD is updated.

docs.title: RaidDto.AlternateIdentifier
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing alternative local or global identifiers for the project or activity associated with the RAiD

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: *

docs.title: RaidDto.AlternateIdentifier.id
docs.text:
Description:

an identifier other than the RAiD applied to the project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: An alternateIdentifer.id may be any alphanumeric string that is unique within its domain of issue, for example a local identifier unique to an organisation. The alternateIdentifier.id represents an additional identifier for the same instance of the project or activity; its referent is identical to that of the RAiD.

Regex pattern: ^\s*\S.*$

docs.title: RaidDto.AlternateIdentifier.type
docs.text:
Description:

free text description of the type of alternateIdentifier supplied

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

metadata schema block containing the subject area of the RAiD plus associated properties

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: *

docs.text:

identifier (URI) for a subject area or classification code describing the project or activity

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

docs.text:

the URI of the subject identifier schema

Requirement: optional

docs.text:
Description:

metadata schema block containing information about any spatial region(s) or named place(s) targeted by the project

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: *

docs.title: RaidDto.SpatialCoverage.id
docs.text:
Description:

spatial region or named place that is the subject or target of the project or activity. Repeat this property as necessary to indicate different locations. Do not duplicate organisational locations

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the geolocation schema used for spatialCoverage

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: OpenStreetMap preferred, Geonames allowed; other geoname servers can be nominated by Registration Agencies.

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/ https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/ https://www.geonames.org/ https://www.geonames.org/

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

https://vocabulary.raid.org/spatialCoverage.schemaUri/167

docs.text:

docs.text:

None

docs.text:

the language used for the access statement text, identified by a code or other identifier

Cardinality: 1

notes: currently limited to ISO 639:2023 (Set 3)

the URI of the language identifier schema

docs.title: RaidDto.SpatialCoverage.SpatialCoveragePlace.text
docs.text:
Description:

free text description of one or more geographic locations that are the subject or target of the project or activity; use to specify or describe a geographic location in a manner not covered by spatialCoverage.id

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

constraints: do not duplicate information from spatialCoverage.id above; do not use for organisational locations (which are derived from the organisation’s ROR)

docs.title: RaidDto.TraditionalKnowledgeLabel
docs.text:
Description:

metadata schema block containing information about Traditional Knowledge / Biocultural Labels and Notices

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: *

docs.title: RaidDto.TraditionalKnowledgeLabel.id
docs.text:
Description:

identifier (URI) linking to a verified source for Traditional Knowledge (TK) or Biocultural (BC) Labels or Notices pertaining to a project or activity

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: Currently only Local Contexts Hub Projects are allowed as a source for validated TK/BC Labels and Notices.

docs.title: RaidDto.TraditionalKnowledgeLabel.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the Traditional Knowledge or Biocultural label identifier schema

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: Currently only Local Contexts Hub Projects are allowed as a source for validated TK/BC Labels and Notices.

docs.title: RaidDto.Id
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing the RAiD name and associated properties.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.id
docs.text:
Description:

The identifier of the raid, e.g. https://raid.org.au/102.100.100/zzz

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

The URI of the Identifier scheme. For example, https://raid.org

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://raid.org/ https://raid.org/

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/identifier.schemaUri/170

RegistrationAgency

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.RegistrationAgency
docs.text:
Description:

metadata schema sub-block declaring the Registration Agency that minted the RAiD.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.RegistrationAgency.id
docs.text:
Description:

the persistent identifier of the RAiD Registration Agency that minted the RAiD

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: The RAiD Registration Authority maintains a canonical list of Registration Agencies.

default: the ROR of the RAiD Registration Agency minting the identifier

Regex pattern: ^https:\/\/ror[.]org/.*$

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.RegistrationAgency.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the identifier scheme that is used to identify RAiD Registration Agencies

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

constraints: a PID is required and (currently) only ROR is allowed

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://ror.org/ https://ror.org/

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/identifier.registrationAgency.schemaUri/242

Owner

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.Owner
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.Owner.id
docs.text:
Description:

the persistent identifier of the legal entity responsible for the RAiD (i.e. the ‘owner’ of a RAiD); as recognised by their Registration Agency

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

Regex pattern: ^https:\/\/ror[.]org/.*$

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.Owner.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the identifier scheme that is used to identify RAiD owners

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://ror.org/ https://ror.org/

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/identifier.registrationAgency.schemaUri/242

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.Owner.servicePoint
docs.text:
Description:

the Service Point (SP) that requested the RAiD. SPs belong to an owner, RAiD owners can have multiple SPs; SPs do not need to be legal entities

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: A RAiD minted by a Registration Agency must have a SP associated with an Owner affiliated with that Agency; Registration Agencies must maintain and register lists of their Service Points with the RAiD Registration Authority.

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.raidAgencyUrl
docs.text:
Description:

The URL for the raid via the minting raid agency system

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.license
docs.text:
Description:

The license under which the RAiD Metadata Record associated with this Identifier has been issued.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: All RAiD metadata is available on a ‘no rights reserved’ basis unless prohibited by law.

constrains: CC-0 only (with fallback to CC-BY-4.0 in jurisdictions where CC-0 is not allowed)

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.version
docs.text:
Description:

The version of the resource. Read-only. Increments automatically on update.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: The RAiD version number is set automatically by the RAiD Service software when a RAiD is updated.

docs.text:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality:

readonly: True

None

docs.text:

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: The controlled list of allowed identifier schemas is defined at https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.schemaUri/215 and is shared across all Registration Agencies.

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://isni.org/ https://isni.org/ https://orcid.org/ https://orcid.org/

https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.schemaUri/215

ContributorPosition

docs.title: RaidPatchRequest.Contributor.ContributorPosition
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative position on a project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1..*

constraints: contributors must have one and only one position at any given time (contributors may also be flagged as a ‘leader’ or ‘contact’ separately).

notes: This property represents a contributor’s administrative position on a project (such as their position on a grant application); use contributor.role to define for scientific or scholarly contribution.

docs.title: RaidPatchRequest.Contributor.ContributorPosition.startDate
docs.text:
Description:

date the contributor began position associated with the project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date, Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available).

docs.title: RaidPatchRequest.Contributor.ContributorPosition.endDate
docs.text:
Description:

date the contributor terminated position associated with the project or activity

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available). Recommended if an organisation has changed roles or terminated its relationship with a project

docs.title: RaidPatchRequest.Contributor.ContributorPosition.id
docs.text:
Description:

a contributor’s administrative position in the project

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: contributor.position.id for first-entered contributor (only) defaults to ‘Principal or Chief Investigator’

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/307 Principal or Chief Investigator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/308 Co-investigator or Collaborator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/309 Partner Investigator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/310 Consultant https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/311 Other Participant

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schemaUri/306

docs.title: RaidPatchRequest.Contributor.ContributorPosition.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the position schema used

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: Controlled list informed by Simon Cox’s Project Ontology, OpenAIRE ‘Project’ guidelines, NIH definitions, ARC definitions, and DataCite Metadata Schema 4.4 Appendix 1 Table 5 ‘Description of contributorType’.

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/305 https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/305

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schemaUri/277

docs.title: RelatedObject
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing inputs, outputs, and process documents related to a RAiD plus associated properties

Requirement: optional

Cardinality:

docs.title: RelatedObject.id
docs.text:
Description:

any (a) input or resource used by a project or activity, (b) output or product created by a project or activity, and/or (c) internal process documentation used within a project or activity, that is identified by a persistent identifier (PID).

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

Regex pattern: ^\s*\S.*$

docs.title: RelatedObject.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

The URI of the relatedObject identifier schema

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: Controlled list is a subset of DataCite Metadata Schema 4.4 Appendix 1 Table 8 ‘Description of relatedIdentiferType’.

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description http://doi.org/ http://doi.org/ http://hdl.handle.net/ http://hdl.handle.net/ https://archive.org/ https://archive.org/ https://arks.org/ https://arks.org/ https://scicrunch.org/resolver/ https://scicrunch.org/resolver/ https://www.isbn-international.org/ https://www.isbn-international.org/

https://vocabulary.raid.org/relatedObject.schemaUri/218

a metadata schema sub-block describing a relatedObject’s type

docs.text:

a type of input, output, or process document

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: Controlled list is a subset of DataCite Metadata Schema 4.4 Appendix 1 Table 7 ‘Description of resourceTypeGeneral’, with ‘Instrument’, ‘Funding’, ‘Learning Object’, ‘Conference Poster’, and ‘Prize’ added (DataCite Metadata Schema 4.5 also adds ‘Instrument’). docs.title: .embargoExpiry
docs.text:
Description:

the date any embargo on access to the RAiD metadata ends

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: Mandatory if access.type is ‘embargoed’. Embargo expiration dates may not lay more than 18 months from the date the RAiD was registered; year, month, and day must be specified.

docs.title: .endDate
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available). Recommended if an organisation has changed roles or terminated its relationship with a project

docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1..*

docs.text:
Description:

metadata schema sub-block containing free-text keyword describing a project plus associated properties

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: *

docs.title: .language
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block declaring the language of the text

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

docs.title: .leader
docs.text:
Description:

flag indicating that the contributor as a project leader

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: More than one contributor can be flagged as a leader if the project is jointly led.

docs.title: .license
docs.text:
Description:

The license under which the RAiD Metadata Record associated with this Identifier has been issued.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: All RAiD metadata is available on a ‘no rights reserved’ basis unless prohibited by law.

constrains: CC-0 only (with fallback to CC-BY-4.0 in jurisdictions where CC-0 is not allowed)

None

None

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: .place
docs.text:
Description:

metadata schema sub-block containing free-text place names or descriptions plus associated metadata properties

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: *

a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative position on a project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

docs.title: .servicePoint
docs.text:
Description:

the Service Point (SP) that requested the RAiD. SPs belong to an owner, RAiD owners can have multiple SPs; SPs do not need to be legal entities

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: A RAiD minted by a Registration Agency must have a SP associated with an Owner affiliated with that Agency; Registration Agencies must maintain and register lists of their Service Points with the RAiD Registration Authority.

metadata schema block containing information about any spatial region(s) or named place(s) targeted by the project

None

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date, Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available).

A string encoding a JSON Pointer. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to a valid object within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.

URI: xsd:string

  • base: str

  • uri: xsd:string

  • repr: str

docs.title: Type: Sparqlpath
docs.text:
A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path. The value of the string MUST conform to SPARQL syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded as RDF.
